page.title: 03DOWLAIS OPENCAST-ENERGY
page.content: Open cast mining is taking place to the North of Dowlais Top where the Coal Measures surface.The continual pounding of the Earth's surface has produced an almost{lunarlike landscape A colossal{bite}has been taken out of the mountainside where the machines have been following the coal seams down from the surface.However,the land that is now being mined consisted of the slag heaps and spoil tips,remnants of a once thriving iron industry.After the coal has been extracted the land is then landscaped and seeded and it is hoped that eventually the scarred landscape will return to its pre-industrial shape which was mainly deeply wooded valleys and unspoilt moorland.Opencast mining appears to be rather a{messy}style of extraction There is constant activity often day and night,by huge lumbering machines
